line.en: 'Hello?'
'Yes?'
'Who is it?'
'Eeek!!'
'Hey, that's sexual harassment! You can't greet\nvisitors when you're not wearing any clothes!'
'Huh? I've got my underwear on.'
'Oh gosh...'
'You're Ageha's younger sister, aren't you?'
'Yes, that's right. I'm Hotaru Himegi. You're\nKotori, is that right?'
'Yes. I'm Kotori Habane.'
'Nice to meet you again, Kotori.'
'...Umm, Kotori, is Ageha here?'
'Ageha, your sister is here!'
'Huh? Oh, hey there Hotaru!'
Ageha brings Hotaru into the dining hall, where\neveryone is having breakfast.
'Ageha, I brought a change of clothes.'
'Thanks! How about Mom? What did she say?'
'That she's gonna kick your ass when you get\nback.'
'Hmm... Can't do much about that, I guess.'
'Hi, Hotaru.'
'Morning, Aoi.'
'You want some breakfast?'
'No, it's OK. I ate at home before I came here.'
'I'm sorry Amane, but could you feed Hat?'
'Sure, leave it to me. C'mon, Hat.'
'Quack!'
'You're looking healthy! It must be because the\nfood here is so delicious!'
'Quaaack!'
It's been a few days since the dormitory became\nour 'camp'. It's become our routine for everyone\nto get together to eat breakfast.
It's really lively, so it makes it feel more like\na camp.
Also, today, we have a special need to have a\ngood breakfast.
Unlike usual, today's work will be a test of our\nendurance.
'It's really sunny today. It looks like the\ntemperature has gone up a notch... Say, Hotaru,\nhow was it out there?'
'The weather is really nice.'
'Munch munch... We'd better put on some\nsunscreen. Oh yeah. If you're free today, Hotaru,\nyou can help us.'
'OK. ...If there's something I can do.'
'There is. Anyone can do it, we just need an\nextra pair of hands.'
'Are we going to polish the wings again?'
'Well, today... munch munch...'
'We're going to make a runway.'
'Make... a runway?'
'This is the runway.'
We stared on at the wide open empty lot,\novergrown with lush grass, in complete\nbewilderment.
'Are we going to tidy this whole place up...?'
'Yes, we are.'
'You told us to prepare ourselves. But actually\nseeing this, it's become quite a scary prospect.'
We are on the verge of completing the main wings,\nso we are finally getting ready for the test\nflight.
This is one of those things... the construction\nof a runway.
In the grassy fields on the other side of the\nlake was a wide, flat area with no gradient.
When we heard the word 'runway', we all imagined\nit to be paved with asphalt, like in an airfield.
'The grass really does grow quickly in the\nsummer, doesn't it?'
Amongst them were overgrown weeds, that would\nneed to be cut down.
While making a glider, we'd be making a runway\ntoo. We have to tidy this place up.
That's why we called for some help.
'Why do I have to do something like this...?'
'We can tell her if you like. We can tell\nEri-chan your embarrassing secret!'
'That's a dirty trick! You really are the lowest\nof the low!'
'You're the same, running your mouth as you go\naround. I really should've kicked your ass for\nthat!'
'Urk... She really is a dude on the inside, after\nall'
Ageha had 'persuaded' Masatsugu to come with us.
'Whoa... this does look tough but we've gotta\ngive it our best shot!'
As a condition for preparing her meals throughout\nthe summer holidays, Kanako has come to help us\ntoo.
'C-Can I really do this?'
Unfortunately for her, Hotaru, who came only to\nbring a change of clothes for Ageha, was brought\nalong too.
'Gah gah...!'
And then there was Hat.
Ducks eat weed, so we didn't need to force him.\nWe just brought him out for a stroll.
'But isn't this private property?'
'Yeah, it is. It would appear that the owner of\nthis field is one of the old members of the\nSoaring Club.'
So, this person is one of the old members of the\nSoaring Club from before Amane and the others\nrevived it.
'On the account that we cut the grass on a\nregular basis, they will lend it to us for free.'
'Well then, let's get started. If we spend too\nmuch time waffling, the sun's gonna go down.'
At the command of Kotori Habane, second in charge\nof the club, we began cutting the grass.
Being in such sweltering heat, makes it all the\nmore difficult.
Here, there is nothing to block the direct\nsunlight, and the wind blowing from the direction\nof the lake only cools us down a bit.
'It's so hot...!!'
The towel wrapped around my head in place of a\nhat is already drenched in sweat.
'We all need to make sure we don't get\nheatstroke.'
It's said that you must drink water at regular\nintervals.
On a day as hot as today, it's best to drink\nsomething before you start to feel thirsty.
'It's no good, can I make a quick trip to the\nconvenience store?'
'How pathetic! Are you a man or not?'
'I'm just a gangly kid who has a part time job, a\nband, and is crazy in love!'
'Kotori, are you OK?'
'Yeah, I'm fine. My butt is getting really sweaty\nthough.'
We thought that it might be impossible for\nKotori, who is in a wheelchair, to do the\nweeding. But even so, she wanted to do it.
I was worried that she, without thinking of the\nworking conditions, would get carried away and\ncollapse.
'Here, have some of this sports drink.'
'Thanks!'
'Eek!'
'What is it, Hotaru?'
A grasshopper came jumping out of the grass that\nshe was about to cut.
'What? It's just a grasshopper.'
Hotaru is hiding behind me, scared.
I caught the grasshopper and put it down in an\narea that we had finished cutting.
'Don't get caught by Hat. He'll eat you.'
Ducks love eating grasshoppers.
'Thanks, Aoi.'
Kanako, using a lawnmower that Ageha borrowed\nfrom a local farm, was cutting down the long\nweeds along one side.
As long as they aren't long enough to get\nentangled around the wheels, it's no problem. So\nthere's no need to pull them out from the root.
'Hey, Hat, you're in the way! This'll make\nmincemeat out of you!'
'Quaaaaack!'
Thinking that the lawnmower is a living thing,\nHat sometimes tries to mess around with it.
'Hey, Aoi. Could you take him away to somewhere\nelse.'
'OK, no problem.'
'Quaaaack!'
Hat, who doesn't want me to pick him up, starts\ngoing crazy as I take him away.
'All right... Here should be OK.'
'Hello Hat!'
'Quaaack!'
'Amane, could you take care of him?'
'Yeah, OK.'
Amane, who usually just stays in the garage, is\nreally throwing herself enthusiastically into\ncutting the grass today.
'That reminds me, that time when you did the test\nflight before. It took off from here, didn't it?'
'Yes.'
'How was the grass at that time?'
'The advisor, Yamanobe-sensei and I did it. Just\nthe parts that needed cutting.'
'Huh...? The advisor?'
'Yes, the advisor.'
I guess that clubs usually have one of those...
But I haven't seen him even once.
'...Hey, Ageha.'
'Hmm? What's up?'
'Do you know Yamanobe-sensei?'
'Yeah, that young male teacher. He's kind of\nlanky and unreliable.'
'Seems like he's our advisor.'
'Yeah, I know.'
She knew about that? As I should've expected.
'Why doesn't he come to supervise our club\nactivities?'
'The previous advisor retired. Yamanobe-sensei\nwas the replacement.'
'He's an amateur when it comes to gliders. It\nseems like he's not really interested.'
'He doesn't want to rock the boat. He won't speak\nout against Tobioka-sensei either.'
'So, she got that teacher to help out, then about\nthe test flight?'
'Yeah. Yamanobe-sensei only helps out when an\nextra pair of hands is needed.'
'In order to fly a glider, one person is not\nenough.'

I don't know what kind of person this
Yamanobe-sensei is. But, he might be in a
difficult position. It definitely looks like
there would be no end to his worries.
She probably didn't want to burden him with\nanything.
I thought about that as I worked hard at building\nthe runway.
I realize that everyone was covered in dirt, and\nit seems that today's bath would feel especially\ngood.
And in that manner, the preparations for the test\nflight gradually proceeded.
We were doing everything for the first time,\ntaking up even the tedious jobs with a feeling of\nfreshness.
Then, one day in August.
At long last...
'We did it!!!!!'
The main wings are finally completed!
Everyone looked at the giant, white-painted wings\nwith an indescribable feeling.
So many things has happened for us to get this\nfar.
'We did it, Kotori.'
'...Yeah.'
Kotori looks tearful due to all the emotional\nfeelings.
'What are you getting all tearful for?'
'I just...'
'...worked so hard... And now, it looks like the\nreal thing... I've never done... anything like\nthis before...'
I know how she feels. However...
'It's still too early, right?'
'That's right. Let's do that after it's taken\nflight.'
'Sniff... you're right.'
Kotori wipes her eyes with her arm, renewing her\nmotivation.
'...There are no distortions, and the surface is\nas smooth as can be.'
Amane looks uncharacteristically serious, as she\nchecks over the two completed main wings.
Distortions inhibit the normal flow of air,\nreducing lift.

Also, unevenness and scratches on the surface,
even those so fine that they cannot be seen by
the naked eye, will cause friction and create
drag.
'These are good wings.'
With Amane's seal of approval, Ageha and Kotori\nhigh five each other and punch the air.
At some point, these two formed a great\npartnership.
'This can really fly, can't it...?'
'Yeah, it can fly.'
Finally, we can do the test flight tomorrow!
'OK, OK, OK... and stop!'
Early morning.
It's finally time for the test flight.
In order to do that, we have to take the glider\nto the runway.
We put the glider on a special trailer for it to\nbe towed by a truck.
'So it's finished, at long last.'

An-chan, who brought the small truck inside the
school from the factory, speaks quietly to
himself when he sees the wings that had been
loaded onto the trailer.
By the way, we received permission for An-chan to\nbring his truck into the school grounds.
That was the first time I had seen the advisor,\nYamanobe-sensei.
As I imagined, he was an honest and good person,\nbut seemed a little timid.
'OK, done, An-chan.'
Ageha lifts her head to let us know that the\ntrailer has been connected to the truck.
'Make sure that the aircraft doesn't rub against\nthe inside of the trailer.'
The glider had been separated into several parts,\nand loaded into the trailer.
If they aren't firmly secured, or if there is any\nfriction during transportation, it is possible\nthat they might get damaged.
'This part's a little loose, isn't it?'
'Ageha, could you grab a towel?'
I put the towel into the gap to act as\ncushioning.
'That should do it.'
'OK then, shall we get going? Kotori is in the\npassenger seat, and the rest of you can get on\nthe cargo bed.'
'Hey you guys. Give me a hand, will ya?'
Ageha and I lift up Kotori and put her down on\nthe passenger seat.
'I could've gone in the back too, though.'
Kotori grumbles a little. I can't say I don't\nknow how she feels.
Ageha and I take her wheelchair and get into the\ncargo bed of the truck.
'Is everything ready?'
'OK!'
'Alright, here we go!'
He starts the engine, and the truck tows the\ntrailer along.
'Hey, everyone!'
As we arrive at the runway, Amane, who reached\nhere first, waves her hand to greet us.
An-chan parks the truck next to the runway and we\njump out of the cargo bed.
'Whew, that was fun!'
'I've always wanted to ride in the cargo bed of a\ntruck!'
'You two look like you were enjoying\nyourselves...'
We help Kotori, who seems quite dejected, out of\nthe passenger seat and onto the wheelchair.
While we do that, An-chan disconnects the trailer\nfrom the truck.
'Hi, Tatsuya.'
'Hey there, Amane.'
'Sorry to have to ask you to help out like\nthis...'
'What? Don't mention it. I'd do anything for\nthese guys.'
'Yeah...'
'Also, it's not like I have nothing to do with\nit. I'm a previous member of the club, after\nall.'
'Oh yeah.'
'To tell the truth, I really wanted to see this\nthing fly...'
'An-chan, are you leaving?'
I was listening from a distance away, but\ncouldn't resist butting in.
'I've got work to do.'
'What? We wanted you to see it too, An-chan.'
'It's OK. If you fly from here, I can see it from\nthe factory.'
'Make sure you watch out for it!'
'Sure. So you'd better do it properly!'
An-chan gives a great big smile, and then returns\nto the truck to leave.
As soon as An-chan left, we immediately began the\nassembly.
The aircraft is still in pieces on the trailer.
First, we put the fuselage on the ground, then we\ntake out the two main wings.
'Kotori, keep an eye out and make sure it doesn't\nhit anything.'
'OK.'
Ageha, Amane and I lift up one of the main wings\nand attach it to the fuselage.
'Be careful with the wind. Even with this amount\nof wind, lift might be generated.'
If a strong wind were to blow straight into this,\nthe lift generated would send the wing, along\nwith us, flying.
After attaching the main wings, next is the\nhorizontal tailplane.
'Slowly... slowly...'
We carefully assemble it, making sure not to bump\nit against anything and getting it scratched.
Standing in front of the completed glider, we are\nall filled with deep emotion.
'So this is what it looks like.'
'It's huge.'
'But it's beautiful...'
Until now, we didn't really know what it would be\nlike to see the full view of our very own\naircraft.
Compared to the regular planes that we are all\nfamiliar with, it looks kind of odd.
In particular, the unusually long wings that we\ncompleted the day before, looks really unbalanced\ncompared to the slightly stubby-looking fuselage.
But I wonder.
Looking at each part, and knowing that in order\nto fly, there is a reason for all of it, it feels\nlike something incredibly beautiful.
'Let's begin the checks.'
Amane, holding the printed out checklist in one\nhand, gives out instructions to everyone.
'Do we have all of the tools?'
'Everything's here.'
Before we fly, we have to make sure that we have\nall the tools required for assembly.
If there's anything missing, it's possible that\nit's still attached to the aircraft.
In such an event, it could cause a huge accident.
'Air in the tires?'
'There's enough in them.'
'Are there any blockages in the Pitot tubes?'
'They're OK.'
'In that case...'
There is a wide range of different things to\ncheck.
We check for wear and tear on the aircraft, and\neven check to see if any bugs have made nests\nanywhere.
At a glance, some of it might seem silly. But,\nwhen we consider that we'll be flying through the\nair in this thing, we can't really say that.
For example, if a bug jams one of the\ninstruments, it could possibly have a negative\neffect on the pilot, and may cause an accident.
That's why we must check these things before the\nflight.
By assembling the glider and doing all the checks\nourselves, we are able to gain a deeper\nunderstanding of the glider.
Amane said that she had made some revisions to a\nchecklist made by one of the old members.
'OK, next is the positive control check.'
As she says that, Amane gets into the cockpit.
'Right aileron.'

The rest of us, standing outside, go to the part
that she calls out, in this case the right
aileron, and hold onto it, making it hard to
move.
Amane moves the yoke to operate the aileron.

At this time, if the yoke can be moved with no
resistance whatsoever, it's possible that the
couplings between the yoke and the aileron have
been cut.

If this were a car, it would be like moving the
steering wheel and the wheels not turning.
Needless to say, that would be extremely
dangerous.
These checks are also carried out on the rudder\nand elevator.
'Everything's OK.'
'OK, Aoi, can you get into the back seat?'
Amane gets out and I sit in the back seat.
Then, we repeat the same checks.
'Flaps and dive brakes are fine.'
Now that the assembly checks have all been\ncompleted, I got out of the cockpit.
Everyone lines up for the briefing.
'Ahem... ah... The wind is calm today, and it's a\nperfect day for a test flight.'

Amane, who would normally be explaining the
precautions at this point, speaks with a gloomy
look on her face that contradicts the things she
is saying.
'That's why there's nothing to worry about. It\nwill definitely... definitely go well.'
'You're the one who's worried, Amane.'
Kotori speaks quite tactlessly, and Amane freezes\nup.
Then...
Shake, shake, shake...
She starts trembling!
'If... if there's no wind, the glider can't fly.\nThat being the case, today is not a good day to\nfly!'
'Hey, what are you talking about...?'
'Hey Kotori, what did you say that for?'
'Well, I didn't mean anything by it...'
'OK, let's cancel for today! We've practiced\nassembling it, so that's enough for now!'
'Hey! What's this all about? After doing all\nthis, we're going to fly it, aren't we?'
'Well, you guys are just beginners, so you don't\nreally know but when flying a glider, usually\nmore windy conditions are...'
'Amane, you're just scared, aren't you!?'
'At times like this, you just have to write a\nChinese character on the palm of your hand over\nand over, then swallow it.'
'No way, I don't believe in superstitions like\nthat!'
She sounds like a kid when she said that.
'It'll be fine. The wind is blowing calmly, so we\nshould be able to fly stably.'
'I think so too.'
'Uh... No way, I'm scared.'
Oh, she said she's scared...
'Then we have no choice... Ageha! Aoi!'
At Kotori's signal, Ageha and I hold Amane firmly\nfrom each side.
'Whoa! What are you doing!?'
'Sorry, Amane...'
'It's for your own good.'
'Stop it! Let me go!'

While we hold onto Amane as she struggles against
us, Kotori writes the Chinese character for
'person' on the palm of her hand a ridiculous
number of times.
'Person, person, person, person, person, person,\nperson, person... Writing it that many times\nshould be enough.'
Then Kotori takes a run-up.
'Hey, there's no need to take a run-up...!'
'No, stop!!!'
'Hyaaaaah!!'
Smack.
'Mmmph!'
Rather than making her eat the 'person'\ncharacters, Kotori slaps her right in the face.
This was just like the kind of thing that happens\nin pro wrestling, where three bad guys team up to\nhurt one of the good guys.
'Hmph! How about that? You're not so scared now,\nare you?'
'Owwww... my nose...'
Having had some fighting spirit slapped into her,\nAmane holds her nose.
'...Looks like it worked a little too well.'
'Why did you slap her in the face like that!?'
'If Amane's nose shrinks because of that, you'll\nhave ruined her good looks!'
This is totally crazy.
'Amane, are you alright?'
'Uh... I'm fine.'
'Thanks everyone, I feel a little braver now.'
Giving a little smile, Amane walks towards the\nwinch.
'Alright, it worked!'
'Ouch!'
'What do you mean!?'
'Argh!'
'Amane is my idol!'
'Ow ow ow... What are you two doing!?'
Kotori chased after us as we went off ahead.
On one side of the runway, is a huge thing that\nlooks like a household generator.
This is the 'winch'.
A glider, which has no thrust of its own, cannot\nfly into the air by itself.

There are a few different ways for it to take
off, a method using a 'towing plane' is often
used, where a regular plane is used to 'tow' the
glider into the air, where it is then released.
This can be done if you can get it to a certain\naltitude to begin with.
However, if you don't have an airplane, which is\nexpensive, you have to use another method.
That's where the winch comes in.
To explain it simply, it's a machine which reels\nin a rope using a giant motor.

The glider is connected to the end of the rope,
which is then lifted to a great height to make it
take off, just like kites that are flown on New
Year.
The difference is that the glider is huge and\nquite heavy. Naturally, the winch has to be huge\ntoo.
'At first, we use full power. Once the aircraft\nreaches an angle of about 30 degrees, we\ngradually decrease the power...'
Amane is teaching Kotori how to use the winch.
She already explained this a few days ago, and\nwe'd tried operating it before, so now is just a\nrecap.

Our roles for today are that Amane and I are the
pilots. Kotori operates the winch, and Ageha
helps with take off and landing as well as ground
control.
By the way, the winch isn't as expensive as a\nplane. But, it still appears to be quite pricey.

It was used by previous members of the Soaring
Club, maintained since and will now be put into
actual use; so it's been in service for many
years.
To be honest, the equipment here goes way beyond\nthe scope of high school club activities.
'OK, I've got it.'
'Well then, let's get ready for take off.'
'Alright.'
We walk back from the winch towards the aircraft.
It's about a kilometer away, so it takes a while.
Amane gets into the front seat, with me following\nher and getting into the back seat.
'Fasten your seatbelt.'
As Ageha tells me to do this, I check the\nseatbelt several times.
'Can your feet reach the pedals? Are there any\nparts that are hard to move?'
'It's OK.'
The canopy, the transparent lid that covers the\ncockpit, is closed.
'Check that the canopy is locked.'
'OK.'
I check the lock.
If it's not properly locked, it may open during\nflight, which is really dangerous.
Amane performs a final check on the flight\ncontrols.
Outside the canopy, Ageha checks the rope\nextending from the winch that is connected to the\nglider.
'Amane, please do a release check!'
Amane operates the release lever, and the hook\nholding the rope is immediately released.
If this isn't released, it's possible that a big\naccident could occur, so it must be checked\nbefore landing.
'OK!'
Ageha gives a signal from outside, and connects\nthe tow rope once again.
We suddenly feel a lot more nervous.
Now, the aircraft will fly through the air...
It still doesn't feel real.
For a start, could an aircraft that we made\nourselves really fly?
There's no engine, and it can't even flap its\nwings like a bird, so will it really be alright?
I've had the theory explained to me many times,\nbut you don't get a feeling for what it's really\nlike from theory alone.
If you want that, the only way is to fly.
Finally, we can fly. Finally...
'Amane?'
'I...I'm OK... I'm not scared, I'm not scared...'
'These wings that everyone made together are much\nbetter than the ones I made.'
'So, it'll be OK...'
'Yes.'
'Kotori got rid of all my fears just now too...'
'But when it comes down to it, it's up to you,\nAoi.'
'Leave it to me.'
This is why I trained on the simulator until I\ngot sick of it.
In my head, I go over the steps for take off.
The most dangerous part of the flight is the\nlanding. However, the take off is also dangerous,\nand accidents can easily occur.
This time, I can rely on Amane, but I need to\nlearn a lot to understand even a little about how\nit's done.
Ageha taps the canopy from outside.
'Are you ready?'

Amane and I reply 'Ready', and Ageha walks round
to the side of the aircraft and lifts up the left
wing that was in contact with the ground. The
aircraft becomes level.

The wings of a glider are really long, and it
can't stand on its wheels like a normal plane.
So, it is placed with one of the wings touching
the ground.
That's why, when launching it, someone has to run\nalong holding the wing up until it gains lift.
Ageha, who is holding up the wing, gives the\nsignal that launch preparations are complete to\nKotori, who is waiting far away.
'Here we go, Aoi.'
As Amane speaks quietly to me...
Whoosh!!
The aircraft suddenly lifts up!
Pulled by the winch, the glider quickly\naccelerates.
The wheels bounce along the unpaved runway.
Ageha ran along while holding up the left wing.
I look at her from the side and our eyes meet.
'See you when you get back!!'
Fwoosh...
A few seconds after the aircraft started moving\nalong the runway, it felt like it was floating\nupwards.
That was after only moving along a few meters.
Then it starts to float slightly while\naccelerating,
'It's rising...!'
Amane pulled back on the yoke.
The aircraft tilts upwards.
I don't know what the angle was, but I felt like\nit was a really steep angle.
'Up, up, and away...!!!'
'Whoooooooaaaaaa...!!'
My whole body was shaking from the G force!
It felt like the floating sensation was equal to\nthe feeling of being pulled by the winch.
I look down through the canopy.
However, at this angle, the main wings block my\nfield of vision. I could hardly see the ground at\nall.
'(How high are we now...?)'
Being unsure of the situation sowed the seeds of\nfear in my mind...
'Releasing the tow rope.'
The feeling of being pulled suddenly disappears,\nand the aircraft floats gently as it has been set\nfree.
That's because it has been released from the\nwinch.
'...We're flying.'
From that moment, the glider was no longer\nborrowing power from something else. It was\nflying all by itself.
I've never experienced this before, this strange\nfeeling of floating.
The sound of the wind is extremely loud.
'Aoi, please check the tow rope.'
I, sitting in the back seat, turn around to see\nthe tow rope that has been safely released.
The rope, with a small parachute attached, falls\nslowly to the ground.
'Release confirmed.'
'Alright, launch successful.'
The glider was able to fly into the sky without\nany problems.
'Aha! It's flying!!'
'It really is flying!!'
'Hey, Kotori!'
'Ageha!! Look, look! It's flying!!'
'Haa haa... I can see!'
'It's amazing... the wings that we made are\nflying...'
'Haa haa... whew... Wow... so that's what it\nlooks like when it's flying...'
'Hee hee hee! I'm getting all emotional!'
'Oh, the rope's coming down. We'd better go and\nretrieve it.'
'It looks like fun, Aoi...!'
'...We really are flying... this is awesome...!!'
'D-...Don't look down. It's scary!'
'You don't need to look down. Please keep looking\nstraight ahead.'
'R-Roger that!'
I check the ground in place of Amane.
We're about 300 meters above the ground.
'Oh, Ageha is going to get the tow rope.'
The tow rope, in other words, the rope coming out\nfrom the winch, was attached to the bottom of the\naircraft by a hook.
The hook can be detached any time from the\ncockpit. This is usually done just before the\nglider reaches the point above the winch.

Even if there is a problem with the controls for
detaching it, once the glider goes past the point
of being directly above the winch and is pulled
from behind, it automatically releases.
Once it's released, a small parachute is opened,\nand it falls slowly back to the ground.
If it's not detached, it can cause a terrible\naccident. So, we must check to see if it has been\nreleased.
As I sat in the back seat, I enjoyed the view\nfrom 300 meters above the ground.
'We're overlooking the city.'
I could see the roof of Flying Fish Manor, which\nwas quite close to the runway. I could also see\nAgeha's house, which looked tiny.
'Ah, it's the school! Wow... we're really\nflying.'
'Can you stop saying 'We're flying, we're\nflying'? ...It makes me feel really aware of it.'
'Oh, sorry...'
Holding my tongue, I simply enjoy my first\nflight.
When I saw the glider flying from below, it\nlooked like it was really carefree as it flew,\nbut...
'(Once you actually ride it... it really does\nfeel carefree after all.)'

However, hearing the rushing sound of the wind,
and the feeling that the wind resistance goes
right into my body, are things that you don't get
from the simulator.
Those things are the forces that keep the glider,\nwhich has no thrust, in the air.
Even when the aircraft moves down slowly, it\ndoesn't feel like it's falling as it flies\nleisurely through the wind.
'...These wings are great.'
'What's that?'
'The stability is outstanding. They really are\ndifferent to the ones that I made.'
'It's all thanks to those guys.'
'Yeah. When we get back, let's give them lots of\nhugs.'
'Turning.'
She said as she tilts the yoke to the right.
The aircraft leans to the right all of a sudden.
'Whoa!'
'Aaaah!'
Amane returns the yoke to its original position,\nand corrects the aircraft which had banked too\nfar, but...
'Whoaaaa...'
She moves it too much and it then banks to the\nleft.
'Amane, what are you doing!?'
'B-...But... this... whoa...!'
'...I wonder what they're doing up there?'
'Dunno, testing the main wings?'
'Even so...'
'It doesn't look so good.'
'Amane, do you read me?'
'Amane, do you read me?'
We received a transmission from Kotori.
'It's shaking about, are you OK?'
'Whoa... maybe not!'
'Amane, calm down!'
Since a few moments earlier, Amane, who had tried\nto level the aircraft, leaned it too far, and\nthen back again, over and over.
'The ailerons are too sensitive... Whoa!'
'Aoi, it's your turn!'
'O-...OK! Amane, I'm taking over!'
'I'll leave it to you!'
Amane lets go of the controls.
In her place, I take over the controls from the\nback seat.
Double-seater gliders have completely the same\ncontrols in both the front and back seats.
'Just like I did in the simulator...'
I try turning it using the yoke to control the\nailerons and the elevator, as well as the pedals\nto control the rudder.
I tilt the yoke to the right and the aircraft\nbanks.
You really only need to move the yoke back to the\nmiddle after banking. But in this case, it needs\nto be moved a little in the opposite direction.
So, this is counter steer...
'I get it!'
'What's up, Aoi!'
'The reaction of the ailerons is too sensitive!\nBut, it's OK. This won't be a problem.'

When I say that 'the reaction is too sensitive',
I mean that if I just move the yoke a little, the
ailerons move more than normal, which causes the
aircraft to lean too far.
They're misaligned. If Amane, who is really\nclumsy, were to use the controls like this, it\ncould be a bit dangerous.
'Are they OK?'
'They're fine. If the worst happens, they can\nalways fall into the lake.'
'Hey, that's not gonna happen, is it...?'
'It's better than falling into the ground.'
'Oh, they've straightened it out.'
'...Phew, it seems like we're level again.'
'Ohhhhh... A...Are you alright, Aoi?'
'Yeah, something like that's no problem.'
It's a little hard to maneuver but it should be\nfine once I get used to it.
'OK, I'll pilot it for a while.'
'Yes, please.'
For now, I'll just fly once around the runway.
I slowly turn the aircraft, and make it turn\naround above Kotori and Ageha.
From above, I can see them both waving.
'(I wonder if An-chan is watching us too?)'
I can just about make out the roof of An-chan's\nfactory from here.
I turn a little more, and now we're above the\nlake.
'Shall we go to the other side of the lake?'
'...Today, the air flow is stable but it looks\nlike it might be difficult to find any vertical\ndrafts.'
If we can't ride the vertical drafts, we can't\nraise the altitude.

Even though we call it flying, in actuality, the
glider is continually falling slowly. So if there
are no vertical drafts, we will have to land at
some point.
'But with these wings, we might be able to do\nit.'
'Roger that. If it looks bad, we'll turn round\nand come back.'
'Huh? Where are they going?'
'Looks like they're heading to Windmill Hill.'
'Will they be able to get there?'
'I dunno...'
The glider proceeds to fly across the lake.
The altitude is gradually dropping but we are\nalright for the time being.
'I'll be watching the instruments.'
'Thank you.'
I learned how to read the instruments with the\nsimulator, but I'm still not used to it.
We just flew straight forward, and after a short\ntime, the other side of the lake came into view.
There, we saw the gentle slopes of the hill and\nthe windmills lined up on top.
Today, the wind is quite weak, so they weren't\nreally turning that much.
'What's that, I wonder...?'
'Hmm? Where?'
'See, over there. It's coming this way. It's a\nplane... isn't it?'
'Oh yeah, you're right. You've always had good\neyesight.'
'...But it's flying awfully low. It doesn't look\nvery fast, either.'
'From over there, we saw you flying for the first\ntime, Amane.'
'Oh... back then, huh?'
That was the day I came back to this town. The\nday it all began.
'That time, Kotori was waving her hand at the\nglider, did you see her?'
'No, I wouldn't have seen something like that...'
'On that day, the airflow was really good but\nstrong, and I didn't feel very comfortable with\nit.'
While we were speaking, we crossed the lake and\nare now above the windmills.
Just like Amane did on that day, we slowly turned\nabove the hill.
It felt really strange to look down at the giant\nwindmills from above.
'It's turning very slowly. What a strange\naircraft.'
'Is that... a glider, by any chance?'
'A glider?'
'Yes. Maybe.'
'A glider...'
'It's flying so slowly. It looks like it would\nfeel nice.'
'If it had an engine, it could fly even faster. I\nwonder why it doesn't have one.'
'Aoi, we're losing a lot of altitude.'
'Roger. Heading back.'
We can't stay here for long. We need to go back\nacross the lake while we still have enough\naltitude.
As we turn back towards the direction of the\nother side of the lake...
'Hmm?'
I could see people on top of the hill.
There are two of them. They must be girls.
It seemed like they were looking up at us.
'(They like gliders, the same as Kotori.)'
While making that up in my head, I leave Windmill\nHill behind me.
'...It's gone.'
'It's just floating, it seems quite unreliable.'
'Yes... but...'
'It felt like it was... flying.'
'Oh, they're back!'
'It's pretty low, isn't it?'
'Looks like they're going to land.'
'Come in, Aoi, can you hear me?'
'Loud and clear. Now commencing landing.'
'Roger. But when they say 'land'...'
'Well then, I'll return the controls to you.'
'Roger that.'
Nodding nervously, Amane grips the yoke.
It's said that landing is the most common time\nfor glider accidents to occur.

Because it's going from flying, to being in
contact with the ground, one mistake can means
it's very easy to suffer some kind of physical
damage.
The landing is difficult and when you push the\nyoke forward to lower the altitude, the speed can\nincrease.

If you're traveling too fast, there will be a
large impact when landing and you won't be able
to stop after landing. It's possible to go past
the end of the runway and collide into something.
That's why you need to lower the altitude while\nkeeping the speed as low as possible.
For that reason, the main wings of gliders are\nequipped with several types of 'lift reducing\napparatus'.
By reducing lift, the altitude can be reduced\nwithout increasing the speed.
Even though a glider is quite simply built, there\nare several different devices equipped for take\noff and landing.
'They're on their way down!'
'Alright, alright, just like that...'
BAM!
'Ack!'
Amane, in a way that could almost be described as\na rough landing, sets us down on the ground with\nthe feeling like we were falling.
The glider, returning to the ground, ran along\nfor a few meters before the wheel brakes stops\nit.
'Welcome back!'
As we open the canopy, Ageha thrusts her face\ninside.
'We made it.'
Taking off the seatbelt, I clamber out of the\nnarrow cockpit.
'Amane, are you OK?'
'Yeah... I'm alright.'
Amane slowly takes off her seatbelt.
I get out first, and help Amane get out too.
It's been a while... well, about ten minutes, but\nI strangely missed being able to put my feet on\nthe ground.
'How was it!?'
Kotori, arriving a little later than Ageha,\nrushes ahead, and starts firing questions at us.
'Well, how should I put it...'
'...It was awesome!!!!!!'
It felt totally incredible. No other impressions\ncame to mind.
'I thought it would be!'
'How long were we flying for?'
'About 15 minutes.'
'Hey, did you go above Windmill Hill.'
'Yeah. Just for a little while. I got a pretty\ngood look at it.'
'Sounds great!'
'Good work, Amane.'
Ageha passes some mineral water to Amane.
The cockpit, that was continually being hit with\ndirect sunshine, was unbearably hot inside.
'Thanks.'
'How were the main wings?'
'They glided through the air much more smoothly\nthan before. It felt really good.'
'Alright!'
'But partway through, it started to wobble,\ndidn't it?'
'Yeah, the ailerons were too twitchy. We need to\nadjust them slightly.'
'Were there any other problems?'
'Hmm... Let me see...'
While Kotori and I were overwhelmed with\nexcitement, beside us, Ageha and Amane were\ntalking about it in a very matter-of-fact manner.
'I'd need to fly it a bit more to be sure but I\nthink that's about it for now.'
'Understood. Well then, shall we just adjust the\nailerons?'
Ageha enthusiastically goes over to get the\ntools.
'What are you doing? Come and help, you guys!\nLet's fly it as much as possible today!'
The testing has only just started.
Then, we did a few more tests.
The main objective for today was to test the main\nwings that had just been completed and check the\nrepaired instruments.
And also to give me flight training.
Thanks to the work I'd put into the simulator, I\nwas able to control it from the very beginning.
I only realized this from flying the real thing,\nbut the simulator that Amane made gives a pretty\nrealistic feeling of flying.
I have to say that's what I'd expected of her.
After adjusting the ailerons, I practiced take\noff and landing and was able to use the basic\nmaneuvers.
As I returned from the fifth flight, Ageha came\nover to us.
'Good work.'
I groan as I open the canopy.
'It's so hot...!!'
'Here, have some water.'
It looks like if you want to fly in this season,\nwater is indispensable.
'You've really gotten used to it, haven't you?'
'Yeah, my body's used to being in the cockpit\nnow.'
'When you turned just now, it was beautiful!\nAlso, when you landed, it was smoother than when\nAmane did it.'
'Aoi is improving quickly...'
Amane speaks in a way that is hard to interpret\nwhether she's pleased or if she's sulking.
It would appear that she still has a complex\nabout her clumsiness.
'I'm feeling quite worn out. I'm gonna take a\nlittle break.'
Getting back on the ground, my legs are a little\nunsteady.
Rather than actually being tired, being in the\nair for so long has messed up my sense of\nbalance.
'We've done enough testing, maybe we can do some\nmore after we have some lunch.'
'Shall we do that?'
We continue with that conversation topic, then\nKotori says...
'I wanna ride it too!'
Amane looked at me.
'No, no, I can't let her ride it with me! You're\nthe one with the license, Amane!'
'But you're already better than me.'
That might be true for just normal flying, but\nthere's no guarantee that there won't be any\nproblems.
If something happens, I won't be able to deal\nwith it.
'Amane, you fly it!'
'Are you serious!?'
Ageha responds instinctively and Amane seems a\nlittle hurt.
However, when I was sitting in the back seat,\nwatching Amane at the controls, I certainly did\nfeel quite nervous.
'It's fine. I think it's worth risking my life\nfor!'
'...It's flying on the wings that we made, after\nall.'
Kotori swallows as she nods.
'OK, I understand. Well then... shall we fly one\nmore time before lunch?'
In her wheelchair, Kotori throws her arms into\nthe air.
'OK, I'll operate the winch. Aoi, we're putting\nKotori in the back seat, so give me a hand.'
'Sure.'
Ageha and I pick up Kotori and put her in the\nback seat.
'How's your seat? It doesn't feel too loose?'
'It feels just right!'
'What's up, Amane?'
'...I'm a bit worried because I don't have Aoi\nhere to help me.'
'Oh... I know how you feel but the person in the\nback should be even more worried.'
'...I'm fine!'
While we continue the preparations, Ageha waits\nover by the winch.
The launch preparations were complete. I gave\nAgeha the signal to commence the launch.
'I'm so excited... I'm so excited...'
'Uhhhhh...'
'I'm so excited... I'm so excited...'
'Uhhhhh...'
'I'm so excited... Huh...?'
The winch isn't moving at all.
'Hey, what's the problem?'
Ageha is waving in this direction.
The next moment...
...Puff.
Black smoke was coming from the winch.
'There's some sort of smoke coming out!'
'Huh...? Oh yeah...'
'I'll be back. Just in case, please release the\ntow rope for now.'
'Roger.'
I check that Amane had released the tow rope,\nthen run over to the winch.
'Haa... haa... What's up?'
'...It looks like it's broken.'
Looking at the black smoke rising up like a\nsignal beacon, Ageha called out, completely at a\nloss as to what to do.
'...It's no good, it's broken.'
Amane sounded like she was in complete despair\nand she looked at the inside of the winch, which\nwas covered in oil.
'Oh... really?'
Kotori, who really wanted to fly, was\ndown-hearted.
It looked like one of the parts in the\ndilapidated old machine has broken and we could\nno longer use it.
'It's a good thing this happened before we tried\nto launch. If this had happened during take off,\nthere could've been a big accident.'
Amane nods as if to say 'You're right'.
'Can this be fixed?'
'Hmm... This might be hard to do ourselves. We\nneed to ask a professional to fix it.'
'That's going to take a long time though, isn't\nit?'
'It will take more than just a day or two.'
For a start, even getting someone to come and get\nsuch a bulky machine would be a tough job in\nitself.
To tell the truth, I'm more worried about the\ncosts than the time it will take.
'That's all for today's testing.'
'Oh my god!'
Sitting in her wheelchair, Kotori goes white with\nshock.
